channel.title: Question about internal flash memory cycles
channel.description:
I'm just wonder what will wear the least on the internal flash mem.
1. Upload to SDcard as startup or 2. Upload to internal flash
I wonder what actually happens when i do Upload to SDcard as startup? Will it then flash the internal mem with the patch file from the SD card every time i boot up the Axoloti in standalone mode? Taking one of the 10 000 write cycles on each boot?
I guess if i flash the internal flash mem from the Axoloti patcher it will only do that one time when i flash it, then only read from the flash mem on every other boot-up in standalone mode.
also what about samples and tables i guess they are stored in different memoey... SDRAM? no need to worry about that right?
Thanks

item.title: Question about internal flash memory cycles
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

mastaman:

I wonder what actually happens when i do Upload to SDcard as startup? Will it then flash the internal mem with the patch file from the SD card every time i boot up the Axoloti in standalone mode? Taking one of the 10 000 write cycles on each boot?

I understand your concern, but it is not an issue.
Patches (either live, from flash memory or from sdcard) are (equally) loaded into RAM to run. Otherwise there would be a performance difference between patches loaded live, sdcard or flash.
SRAM and SDRAM do not have limited write/erase cycles.

best,
Johannes
